1.verse: Greeting - Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, To Philemon, our dear friend and coworker,

2.verse: to Apphia our sister, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the church that meets in your house:

3.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.verse: Philemon’s Love and Faith - I always thank my God as I remember you in my prayers,

5.verse: because I hear about your love and faith that you have toward the Lord Jesus and for all the saints.

6.verse: I pray that this fellowship of your faith may become active in understanding every good thing that belongs to us in Christ.

7.verse: For I have received great joy and encouragement from your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed by you, brother.

8.verse: Appeal on Behalf of Onesimus - For that reason, even though I have plenty of boldness in Christ to order you to do what is proper,

9.verse: I am appealing to you, instead, on the basis of love, just as I, Paul, am an old man and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

10.verse: I am appealing to you on behalf of my child Onesimus. I became his father while I was in chains.

11.verse: There was a time when he was useless to you, but now he is useful both to you and to me.

12.verse: I have sent him (who is my very heart) back to you. Welcome him.

13.verse: I wanted to keep him with me, so that he might serve me in your place while I am in chains for the gospel.

14.verse: But I did not want to do anything without your consent, so that your kindness would not be the result of compulsion, but of willingness.

15.verse: Perhaps this is why he was separated from you for a while: so that you would have him back forever,

16.verse: no longer as a slave, but as more than a slave, as a dear brother. He certainly is dear to me, but he is even more of a dear brother to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

17.verse: So if you consider me your partner, welcome him as you would welcome me.

18.verse: And if he has wronged you in any way or owes you anything, charge it to me.

19.verse: I, Paul, have written this with my own hand: I will repay it—not to mention that you owe me your very self.

20.verse: Yes, brother, I am asking for a favor from you in the Lord. Refresh my heart in Christ.

21.verse: Confident of your obedience, I write to you, knowing that you will do even more than I ask.

22.verse: Just one more thing: Prepare a guest room for me, because I am hoping to be given back to you in answer to your prayers.

23.verse: Closing Words - Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, sends his greetings to you,

24.verse: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my coworkers.

25.verse: The grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
